column2: Those chosen by Auril are selected with little consideration towards her Chosen's wishes. She tends to select those few her embody her fickleness, vanity, and icy-cold heart. Though those who wield the Ring of Winter can also count on her blessing.

Those blessed by Gruumsh as his Chosen are given the strength of a bull, the speed of a wildcat, and increased intelligence. Perhaps most terrifying is that the Chosen is considered to be synonymous with Gruumsh and are called Who-Is-Gruumsh by other orcs.

The Yor'thae, or "Chosen One" in High Drow are Lolth's most venerable priestesses. Those chosen by Lolth are, like their mistress, generally treacherous and cruel. They are Lolth's greatest tools and blessed with powerful abilities because of this.

Those chosen by Mystra are concerned with fighting imbalances in the Weave. They are blessed with unprecedented magical power, magic sensing, immunities to magic, and even immunities to poison and disease.

The Barae, or Chosen of Ubtao, are the undying people who have traditionally ruled the holy city of Mezro as priest-kings. They were granted powerful regenerative and divine abilities and were rumored to turn to dust if Mezro would be destroyed.
Sune chooses her Chosens by their outward and inner beauty. They are expected to keep their appearance as flattering as possible and shower others with sweet words at least five times a month.
The Anth-Malar, as Malar's Chosen is called, is the Beastlord's most fervent worshipper. Malar's blessing turns his chosen into a furry and clawed, bestial humanoid.

Only a select noble few receive the honor of being the Chosen of the entire Seldarine pantheon. Those that are selected receive an expansion of power that only the fellowship of brothers and sisters of the wood can grant.

The Chosen of Umberlee are primarily pirates or sea monsters who are able to properly stoke the ego of the Wavemother. Umberlee grants her Chosen a taste of her destructive power so they may spread terror in her name.

The Chosen of Bane are tyrants in every sense of the word, consumed with the quest for absolute power. They are both charismatic and filled with hate, preferring to dominate and instill fear in weaker beings.
The Chosen of Bhaal are supreme assassins and killers, selected for their ability to spread death without thought for morality.
The Chosen of Talona are plaguebearers blessed by their goddess with immunity to the effects of these contagions. Furthermore, they are masters of poison and seek to befoul all in their path.
The Chosen of Eilistraee are champions of the cause of redemption for the drow and relentless foes of all the evil powers of the Underdark.
An avatar is the physical manifestation of a god on the material plane. An avatar does not age, and is in many ways imperishable. But if it should die, the god can recreate it in a matter of days.
This character, though not of an Estelar faith, has a special sympathy and understanding of the worshippers of the Estelar.
Sympathy for worshippers of the Primal Gods.
This character, though not of an Primal God's faith, has a special sympathy and understanding of the worshippers of these gods.
This character, though not of an Dark Estelar faith, has a special sympathy and understanding of the worshippers of the Dark Estelar Gods.
This character, though not of a Zakharan faith, has a special sympathy and understanding of the worshippers of the Zakharans.
This character, though not of a Kara-Turan faith, has a special sympathy and understanding of the worshippers of the Kara-Turan Gods and philosophies.
Sympathy for the Elven Gods worshippers
This character, though not of an Elven faith, has a special sympathy and understanding of the worshippers of the Elven Gods.
This character, though not of a Drow faith, has a special sympathy and understanding of the worshippers of the Drow Gods.
This character, though not of a Dwarven faith, has a special sympathy and understanding of the worshippers of the Dwarven Gods.
This character, though not of a Giant faith, has a special sympathy and understanding of the worshippers of the Giant Gods.
This character, though not of a Draconic faith, has a special sympathy and understanding of the worshippers of the Draconic Gods.
This character does not discriminate against others for their religious beliefs, provided they do not worship evil or monstrous deities.
Rumour has it that the source of this character's beauty is an infernal contract.
Rumour has it that the source of this character's genius is an infernal contract.
Rumour has it that the source of this character's strength is an infernal contract.
Rumour has it that this character is bound by an infernal contract, willingly or otherwise.
